intro: Santiria acuminata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved santiria, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small yellow flowers that are typically arranged in clusters. Santiria acuminata is often found in moist, tropical environments and is sometimes used in traditional medicine. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological and pharmacological studies.
